thread.title: NatWest suffers online login and payments crash
thread.title_full: NatWest suffers online login and payments crash

title: NatWest suffers online login and payments crash
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Aug 31, 2015, 12:19 BST - UK Markets closed for Summer Bank holiday NatWest suffers online login and payments crash By Tim Wallace | Telegraph – 19 minutes ago 0.0001 0.0000 
Customers are complaining that they cannot log on to the banking service, and even those who can get in are unable to make payments 
NatWest’s payment system has crashed, leaving customers unable to transfer funds even to other accounts within the bank. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) comes just two months after the Royal Bank of Scotland (LSE: RBS.L - news ) , which runs the NatWest brand, had another IT error which delayed around 600,000 payments for several days. 
The group also suffered an international business banking glitch earlier in the day, which was quickly resolved. 
Earlier in the summer the bank revealed it was investing £3.5bn into making its systems more resilient, in the hope that it could stop these regular breakdowns. 
But it has not worked yet, as customers are regularly left without service. 
Customers have so far not received information from the bank on when the problem may be fixed, with the customer service Twitter (Xetra: A1W6XZ - news ) account seemingly unaware of the problem. 
RBS is not the only bank which has suffered problems. On Friday more than quarter of a million HSBC payments failed to go through on time, leaving workers waiting until late that night or early the next day for their pay cheques ahead of the long weekend. 
However, RBS has had more problems than the other big banks. 
In 2012 a payments crash rumbled on for several weeks, resulting in a £56m fine from the regulators, and it has been hit by a series of problems since.
